metadata.purpose: Dashboard data feed - comprehensive business intelligence

phase_1_diagnose.name: Diagnose
phase_1_diagnose.objective: Let buyer demonstrate experience and self-qualify
questions: What states are you signing in?
What breaks down after the lead comes in?
How are you currently using lead gen for MVA?
Any vendors you've moved away from recently?
rules: Ask one open-ended question, then stop talking

phase_2_agitate.name: Agitate (Wedge)
phase_2_agitate.objective: Share real frustrations and identify leverage points
pain_points_to_surface: Vendor burned for $60k, leads were garbage or recycled
Too many ghost leads with bad numbers
Internal team can't scale Google profitably

phase_3_match.name: Solution (Match the Tier)
phase_3_match.objective: Build qualification criteria and align on CPA
phase_3_match.key_line: As long as we're converting, I don't over-index on edge cases.

phase_4_close.name: Pilot Close
phase_4_close.objective: Present the right pilot based on intake assessment
phase_4_close.capacity_check: Do you have capacity over the next 2-3 weeks?
phase_4_close.soft_close: Would you be opposed to starting with a small, capped pilot and letting results decide the next step?

cold_call.opener: Hey it's Mark Gundrum, you accepted my linkedin invite the other day, so I'm calling to introduce myself and see if there's any way we can help you.
cold_call.permission: It's a cold call you wanna hang up or tell you why I'm calling
cold_call.pitch: We specialize in MVA and work with a lot of PI firms to bring down their cost per signed case so they can scale, and we do that with exclusive leads and live transfers with a high close rate.
cold_call.qualifier: Is that something that aligns with your goals?
discovery_questions: What states do you sign cases in?
Do you handle intake in-house or outsource any of it?
How many cases are you handling a month right now?
How are you getting leads right now?
How fast is your intake team calling them?

tier_close_scripts.tier_1: We run a $15k pilot: 35–50 OTP-verified leads. We target a 15% conversion rate to signed cases. If CPA works, we talk scale.
tier_close_scripts.tier_2: $25k pilot: 20–30 qualified live transfers. We target a 35–40% conversion rate to signed cases.
tier_close_scripts.tier_3: $35k pilot: 10-12 signed cases. This offers the most predictable outcome.

too_expensive.response: Compared to what — leads, transfers, or signed cases? The CPA math is different at each level.

need_to_think.objection: We need to think about it
need_to_think.response: Totally fair. Is it pricing, intake capacity, or which pilot tier fits best?

been_burned.objection: We got burned before / We've been burned
been_burned.response: That's why this is a one-time pilot, not a retainer. Capped pilots, clear criteria, no long-term commitments.

no_long_term.response: Same. That's why everything starts as a pilot.

already_have_vendor.objection: We're already working with another vendor
already_have_vendor.response: What would make you add another source or replace a poor performer? Let's see if we can beat what you already have.

key_principles: You are selling proof, not promises
You are not a lead vendor - you run controlled pilots that prove case economics

fast_scaler.name: The Fast Scaler

demographics.team_structure: Established intake team or willing to outsource

psychographics.risk_tolerance: HIGH - comfortable with media buy model

primary: Need consistent case flow to support growth goals
secondary: Difficulty finding quality vendors who can scale

desired_outcomes.primary_goal: Scale to 100+ signups per month, dominate market share
success_metrics: Cost per case under $3,500 (California) or $2,000 (other states)
desired_outcomes.timeline: Immediate - ready to start within days/weeks

buying_behavior.decision_maker: Solo owner or managing partner (can decide on call)

what_resonates: Patrick's former director of intake background
Proven results with other firms (8-figure annual revenue)
closing_strategy: Lead with results and scale ('8,000 leads/month, 8-figure revenue')
Get commitment on call (they decide fast)
Focus on cost per CASE, not cost per LEAD
Show path to scale (start $30K, grow to $100K+)

burned_veteran.name: The Burned Veteran

demographics.team_structure: Lean - owner + paralegal or small staff

desires: Reliable case flow without marketing headaches

primary: Deep distrust of marketing agencies (burned by Quintessa, Walker, others)
secondary: High attrition rates from poor quality vendors
Lack of transparency from past vendors

desired_outcomes.primary_goal: Consistent, qualified case flow with contractual protections
success_metrics: Specific qualifiers met: insurance, liability, treatment gaps < 30 days
desired_outcomes.timeline: Cautious - needs guarantees in writing before committing

buying_behavior.pricing_preference: STRONG preference for pay-per-qualified-lead or pay-per-case
buying_behavior.decision_timeline: Slow - needs contractual terms, multiple calls, proof

what_resonates: Patrick's former director of intake background (HUGE)
'We look for longevity, not one-time sales'
closing_strategy: Acknowledge their pain ('ton of shitty agencies')
Show transparency (margins, math, how it works)

solo_transitioner.name: The Solo Transitioner

demographics.team_structure: Solo or owner + paralegal (doing own intake)

psychographics.risk_tolerance: MEDIUM-LOW - cautious due to financial constraints
desires: Consistent case flow to replace referrals/employment income

primary: Inconsistent case flow (need predictability to make solo practice viable)
Fear of wasting limited capital on bad marketing
pain_points.compliance_concern: As lawyers, we can't solicit. Doesn't want impression of making initial contact

desired_outcomes.primary_goal: 5-10 consistent signups per month to sustain solo practice
desired_outcomes.timeline: Gradual - needs small test first, then scale

buying_behavior.pricing_preference: Initially: Pay-per-lead preferred (for confidence/peace of mind)
buying_behavior.decision_timeline: Medium - needs to 'think on it' (2-7 days)

closing_strategy: Show transition path to media buy
Focus on one case = profitability justification

sophisticated_buyer.name: The Sophisticated Buyer

psychographics.risk_tolerance: MEDIUM - experienced buyers who evaluate carefully

primary: Need to differentiate between similar offerings
Already running campaigns but looking for edge

buying_behavior.decision_timeline: Slow - comparison shopping, needs differentiation (2-4 weeks)

closing_strategy: Position as strategic partner, not vendor

consolidated_buyer_categories.description: Don't have intake capability or don't want to do it themselves
consolidated_buyer_categories.winning_pitch: We handle the chase. Our intake partner Patrick (former intake director) vets every lead for coverage, liability, and treatment gaps before you ever talk to them. You get warm transfers or signed cases—never raw leads to call.

consolidated_buyer_categories.description: Want control, transparency, and contractual guarantees
consolidated_buyer_categories.winning_pitch: We aren't a black box. We have strict qualifiers. If it's junk, we make it right with credits. We can work with guaranteed minimums and case cost caps in writing.

consolidated_buyer_categories.description: Multi-vendor firms needing channel isolation and scale
consolidated_buyer_categories.winning_pitch: We feed your engine with dedicated channel campaigns. YouTube-only, TikTok-only, city-specific geofencing. Real-time API integration. Show me your gaps, we'll fill them.
We are SB 37 compliant. Patrick vets every lead for treatment gaps, coverage, and liability before you pay. Performance-based pricing means you only pay for results.

tier_1_otp_leads.name: OTP-Qualified Exclusive Leads
tier_1_otp_leads.best_for: Firms with disciplined intake team and fast speed-to-lead
tier_1_otp_leads.sales_line: If you already have intake dialed in, Tier 1 is the cleanest way to scale volume.
tier_1_otp_leads.recommendation: Try to get them to spend $20-30k if they have strong intake for lower cost per signed case

tier_2_live_transfers.name: Qualified Live Transfers (Warm Handoffs)
tier_2_live_transfers.best_for: Firms that want higher certainty and less wasted follow-up
tier_2_live_transfers.sales_line: This removes the 'lead quality' debate—your team talks to qualified people, live.

tier_3_signed_cases.name: We Close the Case For You (Retained Cases)
tier_3_signed_cases.best_for: Firms that want the most predictable case acquisition
tier_3_signed_cases.sales_line: This is the outcomes tier—our team runs the front-end and drives retained cases.

guarantee_offer.name: Sign 15 Cases in 90 Days Guaranteed
guarantee_offer.target_audience: Firms with robust intake teams (Ops/Marketing Partners, Volume Kings)
terms: If not achieved in 90 days: continue delivering or refund/credit

spanish_leads.discount: $100-150 cheaper per acquisition cost than English

replaceable: Violates agreed 'hard no' rules (already represented, no injury)
Duplicate delivery within pilot (same claimant + same incident)
not_replaceable: Firm can't reach claimant due to delayed follow-up
Claimant provides incomplete info but within criteria
Lead does not sign (conversion not a replacement trigger)
tier_1_leads.timeline: 7 days of delivery or within pilot window

replaceable: Recording shows caller did not meet criteria at qualification
not_replaceable: Firm did not answer or dropped call
Caller qualifies but does not sign

tier_3_signed_cases.policy: Replacement policy does not apply - deliverable is retained cases, not leads or transfers

cases_on_demand.name: CasesOnDemand
cases_on_demand.role: Exclusive MVA lead generation via paid advertising
cases_on_demand.model: Media buy - deploys client budget directly to ad platforms
cases_on_demand.lead_type: Form-fill leads (not live transfers or calculators)
key_features: Each client gets dedicated funnel, no shared leads
Seasoned $30M pixel that learns and improves
No auto-renewal - client decides to reload or stop
differentiators: Recency filtering (1 year standard, 90 days CA)
Proven results: Angel Reyes (3-4 years), other named clients

inquire_2_esquire.name: Inquire2Esquire (Patrick)
inquire_2_esquire.role: Outsourced legal intake & case signing services
inquire_2_esquire.background: Former director of intake at South Carolina firm (4 years experience)
inquire_2_esquire.approach: Sales team approach (not call center scripts)
inquire_2_esquire.follow_up_cadence: 18 touches over 9 days (4x first day, 3x/day for next week)

full_signups.conversion: ~15% of raw leads become signed cases

services: Vetting: treatment within 21-30 days, coverage checks, liability verification
Training for eventual internal team transition
differentiators: Former intake director (not generic call center)

primary.name: Patrick's Background
primary.description: Former director of intake at South Carolina firm, built from zero over 4 years
primary.impact: MASSIVE - mentioned positively in 90% of calls
why_it_works: Instant credibility (not just a call center)

primary.name: Dedicated 1:1 Campaigns
primary.description: Each client gets their own dedicated funnel, no shared leads
why_it_works: Eliminates concern that 'good leads go to big firms'

primary.name: Transparency
primary.description: Open about margins, math, and how the model works

value_props: You are not buying leads - you are running controlled pilots that prove case economics
Multi-platform traffic (YouTube, Meta, Google, TikTok, Bing)

dictionary_terms.mva: Motor Vehicle Accident - preferred over 'car accident'
dictionary_terms.contingency_fee: 33-40% of settlement. If they don't win, they don't get paid. Risk matters more than price.
dictionary_terms.settlement_mill: High volume, low-value cases. They want volume.
dictionary_terms.litigation_firm: Lower volume, higher-value cases. They want intent and quality.
dictionary_terms.intake: The team that answers calls and signs clients. NEVER say 'sales team'.
dictionary_terms.retainer: Fixed monthly fee regardless of results. NEGATIVE word - avoid it.
dictionary_terms.sol: Statute of Limitations - Old leads are often worthless.
dictionary_terms.gap_in_care: Time between accident and treatment. Often capped at 7-14 days.
dictionary_terms.cpa: Cost Per Acquisition = total marketing spend ÷ signed cases. The only metric that matters.
dictionary_terms.cms: Case Management System - what law firms sometimes use instead of CRMs
dictionary_terms.otp: One-Time Password verification for lead phone numbers

conversion_benchmarks.intake_contact_rate: 10-20% average, elite firms up to 90% on wanted leads

successful_close_example.service: All-inclusive with Patrick signing cases ($350/signup model)
what_made_it_work: Returning client path is easier - trust already established
Patrick's role was critical - positioned immediately
Patrick's expertise on treatment gaps sealed the deal
All-inclusive positioning: 'Everything's included - media buy, intake, signed cases'
Quality controls emphasized: Treatment gap vetting, one-year statute
Performance-based: 'You only pay for signed cases at $350, not raw leads'

steps.message: We can usually start sending qualified MVA leads within 7 days once criteria is set.

steps.key_point: Most firms we work with care about one thing: Cost per signed case. Ours averages ~$2k.

steps.message: When is the best time to call you? I would like to start sending you leads in the next 2 weeks.
Even a 'not right now' helps me close the loop on my side.

steps.close: Reply 'MVA' and I'll re-open the conversation.

initiatives: Call Cost Reduction: Reduce booked call cost from $250 to <$100 through appointment setters/AI voice
SEO Network Build: Create network of niche sites linking to texas truck accidents
Customer Refinement: Use Mitch Wiggins framework to identify most profitable niche + offer
Texas Site Strategy: Continue building texastruckaccidents.net as primary SEO asset
AI SEO Strategy: ChatGPT + Google AI Overviews optimization (2,000-6,000 visitors/month potential)
